items.title: Reliance on 'gut feelings' linked to belief in fake news
items.summary: People who tend to trust their intuition or to believe that the facts they hear are politically biased are more likely to stand behind inaccurate beliefs, a new study suggests.

alternate.title: Reliance on 'gut feelings' linked to belief in fake news

items.title: Relationship found between HIV risk and individual and community level educational status
items.summary: African-American men who have sex with men (MSM) remain at heightened risk for HIV infection and account for the largest number of African-Americans living with HIV/AIDS. It has long been understood that there is a clear and persistent association between poverty, transactional sex behavior, and HIV risk. A new study has investigated how educational status relates to HIV risk in this population.

alternate.title: Relationship found between HIV risk and individual and community level educational status

items.title: MicroRNA helps cancer evade immune system
items.summary: Researchers have discovered how oxygen-deprived tumors survive body's immune response, explains a new report.

alternate.title: MicroRNA helps cancer evade immune system

thumbnail.title: MicroRNA helps cancer evade immune system

items.title: Chemists make playdough/lego-like hybrid to create tiny building blocks
items.summary: Playdough and Legos are among the most popular childhood building toys. But what could you use if you wanted to create something really small â€” a structure less than the width of a human hair? It turns out, a team of chemists has found, this can be achieved by creating particles that have both playdough and Lego traits.

alternate.title: Chemists make playdough/lego-like hybrid to create tiny building blocks

thumbnail.title: Chemists make playdough/lego-like hybrid to create tiny building blocks

items.title: Video game boosts sex health IQ and attitudes in minority teens
items.summary: A video game to promote health and reduce risky behavior in teens improves sexual health knowledge and attitudes among minority youth, according to a new study. The findings validate the value of the video game as a tool to engage and educate teens at risk for HIV and other sexually transmitted infections, said the researchers.

alternate.title: Video game boosts sex health IQ and attitudes in minority teens

thumbnail.title: Video game boosts sex health IQ and attitudes in minority teens

items.title: Genomic recycling: Ancestral genes take on new roles
items.summary: One often hears about the multitude of genes we have in common with chimps, birds or other living creatures, but such comparisons are sometimes misleading. The shared percentage usually refers only to genes that encode instructions for making proteins -- while overlooking regulatory genes, which nonetheless make up a large part of the genome.

alternate.title: Genomic recycling: Ancestral genes take on new roles

items.title: How bacteria hinder chemotherapy
items.summary: Scientists have found bacteria in pancreatic tumors that metabolize a common drug, explains a new report.

items.title: Altitude training for cancer-fighting cells
items.summary: Oxygen starvation could toughen up immune T cells for cancer immunotherapy, reports a team of investigators.
